content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. explore the world
2. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called .twitter_keys. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 14:16:12 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As a system, I used the "browse_website" command with the URL "https://www.timeout.com/newyork/attractions/best-museum-exhibitions-in-nyc" and the question "What are some of the current exhibitions at the Metropolitan Museum of Art?" to gather more information. My computer returned a list of current exhibitions at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, which I saved to a file named "current_exhibitions_metropolitan_museum_of_art.txt" using the "write_to_file" command. The list includes a rooftop garden installation by Lauren Halsey, "Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty" showcasing the late designer's fashion pieces, "Berenice Abbott's New York Album, 1929" featuring black-and-white images of New York City, "Richard Avedon: Murals" showcasing life-size photomurals, "The Facade Commission: Hew Locke, Gilt" featuring gold-hued sculptures on the exterior of the museum, and a permanent exhibition called "The Polonsky Exhibition of The New York Public Library's Treasures" displaying over 250 unique and rare items from the library's research centers. I received a command to delete an agent with a specific key. However, the command returned an error message. I then used the "list_agents" command, which returned a list of agents. I proceeded to start a new agent named "my_gpt_agent" with the task of generating text in response to the prompt "What is the meaning of life?"

Command start_agent returned: Agent my_gpt_agent created with key 0. First response: As an AI language model, I don't have a personal belief or philosophy. The meaning of life is subjective and varies from person to person. It is a question that has puzzled philosophers, scientists, and theologians for centuries. Some people believe that the meaning of life is to seek happiness, while others believe it is to serve a higher purpose or to achieve a particular goal. Ultimately, the meaning of life is a question that each person must answer for themselves based on their own beliefs and values.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command message_agent returned: Sure, I'd be happy to tell you about the history of the Eiffel Tower!

The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. It was named after Gustave Eiffel, the engineer whose company designed and built the tower. The tower was constructed in 1889 as the entrance arch to the 1889 World's Fair, which was held in Paris to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution.

The tower was initially met with skepticism and criticism from many Parisians, who thought it was an eyesore and would ruin the city's skyline. However, it quickly became a popular attraction and a symbol of France, and it has since become one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world.

The tower stands at 324 meters (1,063 feet) tall, making it the tallest structure in Paris. It held the title of the tallest man-made structure in the world for 41 years until it was surpassed by the Chrysler Building in New York City in 1930.

Today, the Eiffel Tower remains one of the most visited tourist attractions in the world, with millions of visitors every year. It has also been used for various scientific and cultural purposes, such as radio transmissions, meteorological observations, and as a backdrop for films and television shows.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command read_file returned: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. It was named after Gustave Eiffel, the engineer whose company designed and built the tower. The tower was constructed in 1889 as the entrance arch to the 1889 World's Fair, which was held in Paris to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution.

The tower was initially met with skepticism and criticism from many Parisians, who thought it was an eyesore and would ruin the city's skyline. However, it quickly became a popular attraction and a symbol of France, and it has since become one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world.

The tower stands at 324 meters (1,063 feet) tall, making it the tallest structure in Paris. It held the title of the tallest man-made structure in the world for 41 years until it was surpassed by the Chrysler Building in New York City in 1930.

Today, the Eiffel Tower remains one of the most visited tourist attractions in the world, with millions of visitors every year. It has also been used for various scientific and cultural purposes, such as radio transmissions, meteorological observations, and as a backdrop for films and television shows.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
